domain_name.description: DNS queries for this domain name are forwarded to the IP addresses that are specified using `target_ip`.

rule_type.description: The rule type. Valid values are `FORWARD`, `SYSTEM` and `RECURSIVE`.

name.description: A friendly name that lets you easily find a rule in the Resolver dashboard in the Route 53 console.

resolver_endpoint_id.description: The ID of the outbound resolver endpoint that you want to use to route DNS queries to the IP addresses that you specify using `target_ip`.

tags.description: A mapping of tags to assign to the resource.

ip.description: One IP address that you want to forward DNS queries to. You can specify only IPv4 addresses.

port.description: The port at `ip` that you want to forward DNS queries to. Default value is `53`

id.description: The ID of the resolver rule.

arn.description: The ARN (Amazon Resource Name) for the resolver rule.

owner_id.description: When a rule is shared with another AWS account, the account ID of the account that the rule is shared with.

share_status.description: Whether the rules is shared and, if so, whether the current account is sharing the rule with another account, or another account is sharing the rule with the current account.
